info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 11:48PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, Stephens, Habersham, south central Rabun, northwestern Hart, northwestern Anderson, southern Pickens and Oconee Counties through 1230 AM EST... At 1146 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Clayton to 7 miles west of Gainesville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clemson, Toccoa, Seneca, Walhalla, Clarkesville, Carnesville, Easley, Powdersville, Central and Cornelia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EST for northeastern Georgia...and Upstate South Carolina.
